trans-unit.source: Creates a dialog box that lets the user specify the drive, directory, and the name of a file or set of files to be opened

seg-source.mrk: Creates a dialog box that lets the user specify the drive, directory, and the name of a file or set of files to be opened

target.mrk: Creates a dialog box that lets the user specify the drive, directory, and the name of a file or set of files to be opened

trans-unit.source: [optional] A string to be placed in the title bar of the dialog box.

seg-source.mrk: A string to be placed in the title bar of the dialog box.

target.mrk: A string to be placed in the title bar of the dialog box.

trans-unit.source: If this parameter is empty string (Default), the system uses the default title (that is, "Open").

seg-source.mrk: If this parameter is empty string (Default), the system uses the default title (that is, "Open").

target.mrk: If this parameter is empty string (Default), the system uses the default title (that is, "Open").

trans-unit.source: [optional] The pairs of filter strings (for example, "Text Files (*.txt)"). To specify multiple filter patterns for a single display string, use a semicolon to separate the patterns (for example, "*.txt;*.doc;*.bak").

seg-source.mrk: The pairs of filter strings (for example, "Text Files (*.txt)").
To specify multiple filter patterns for a single display string, use a semicolon to separate the patterns (for example, "*.txt;*.doc;*.bak").

target.mrk: The pairs of filter strings (for example, "Text Files (*.txt)").
To specify multiple filter patterns for a single display string, use a semicolon to separate the patterns (for example, "*.txt;*.doc;*.bak").

trans-unit.source: Do not include spaces in the pattern. To specify multiple groups of filters, use the "|" character as a delimiter (for example, "Text Files (*.txt)|All Files (*.*)").

seg-source.mrk: Do not include spaces in the pattern.
To specify multiple groups of filters, use the "|" character as a delimiter (for example, "Text Files (*.txt)|All Files (*.*)").

target.mrk: Do not include spaces in the pattern.
To specify multiple groups of filters, use the "|" character as a delimiter (for example, "Text Files (*.txt)|All Files (*.*)").

trans-unit.source: If this parameter is omitted or an empty string (Default), the dialog box does not display any filters.

seg-source.mrk: If this parameter is omitted or an empty string (Default), the dialog box does not display any filters.

target.mrk: If this parameter is omitted or an empty string (Default), the dialog box does not display any filters.

trans-unit.source: [optional] The 1-based index of the currently selected filter to initialize the combo box control.

seg-source.mrk: The 1-based index of the currently selected filter to initialize the combo box control.

target.mrk: The 1-based index of the currently selected filter to initialize the combo box control.

trans-unit.source: [optional] The file name to initialize the edit control.

seg-source.mrk: The file name to initialize the edit control.

target.mrk: The file name to initialize the edit control.

trans-unit.source: [optional] The default extension that appends to the file name if the user fails to type an extension.

seg-source.mrk: The default extension that appends to the file name if the user fails to type an extension.

target.mrk: The default extension that appends to the file name if the user fails to type an extension.

trans-unit.source: This string can be any length, but only the first three characters are appended. The string should not contain a period (.). If this parameter is empty string (Default), no extension is appended.

seg-source.mrk: This string can be any length, but only the first three characters are appended.
The string should not contain a period (.).
If this parameter is empty string (Default), no extension is appended.

target.mrk: This string can be any length, but only the first three characters are appended.
The string should not contain a period (.).
If this parameter is empty string (Default), no extension is appended.

trans-unit.source: [optional] A set of bit flags you can use to initialize the dialog box.

seg-source.mrk: A set of bit flags you can use to initialize the dialog box.

target.mrk: A set of bit flags you can use to initialize the dialog box.

trans-unit.source: This parameter can be 0 or combination of the following values.

seg-source.mrk: This parameter can be 0 or combination of the following values.

target.mrk: This parameter can be 0 or combination of the following values.

trans-unit.source: [optional] A set of bit flags you can use to initialize the dialog box. It can be 0 or the following value:

seg-source.mrk: A set of bit flags you can use to initialize the dialog box.
It can be 0 or the following value:

target.mrk: A set of bit flags you can use to initialize the dialog box.
It can be 0 or the following value:

trans-unit.source: [optional] A pointer to a hook procedure. This parameter is ignored unless the $OFN_ENABLEHOOK flag is set.

seg-source.mrk: A pointer to a hook procedure.
This parameter is ignored unless the $OFN_ENABLEHOOK flag is set.

target.mrk: A pointer to a hook procedure.
This parameter is ignored unless the $OFN_ENABLEHOOK flag is set.

trans-unit.source: [optional] Application-defined data pointer that the system passes to the hook procedure.

seg-source.mrk: Application-defined data pointer that the system passes to the hook procedure.

target.mrk: Application-defined data pointer that the system passes to the hook procedure.

trans-unit.source: [optional] A handle to the parent window for the dialog box.

seg-source.mrk: A handle to the parent window for the dialog box.

target.mrk: A handle to the parent window for the dialog box.

trans-unit.source: the full path of the input file if the $OFN_ALLOWMULTISELECT flag is not set, otherwise always an array of paths.

seg-source.mrk: the full path of the input file if the $OFN_ALLOWMULTISELECT flag is not set, otherwise always an array of paths.

target.mrk: the full path of the input file if the $OFN_ALLOWMULTISELECT flag is not set, otherwise always an array of paths.

trans-unit.source: The zeroth array element contains the number of files.

seg-source.mrk: The zeroth array element contains the number of files.

target.mrk: The zeroth array element contains the number of files.

trans-unit.source: sets the @error flag to non-zero, @extended flag may contain the dialog box error code ($CDERR_* or $FNERR_*).

seg-source.mrk: sets the @error flag to non-zero, @extended flag may contain the dialog box error code ($CDERR_* or $FNERR_*).

target.mrk: sets the @error flag to non-zero, @extended flag may contain the dialog box error code ($CDERR_* or $FNERR_*).

trans-unit.source: Call _WinAPI_GetExtended() to retrieve internal $tagOPENFILENAME structure containing the user's selection information after closing the dialog box.

seg-source.mrk: Call _WinAPI_GetExtended() to retrieve internal $tagOPENFILENAME structure containing the user's selection information after closing the dialog box.

target.mrk: Call _WinAPI_GetExtended() to retrieve internal $tagOPENFILENAME structure containing the user's selection information after closing the dialog box.

trans-unit.source: If you use a hook, you can not preserve the UI of the dialog box like in Windows Vista or later.

seg-source.mrk: If you use a hook, you can not preserve the UI of the dialog box like in Windows Vista or later.

target.mrk: If you use a hook, you can not preserve the UI of the dialog box like in Windows Vista or later.

trans-unit.source: Single file selection (returns the fully qualified path)

seg-source.mrk: Single file selection (returns the fully qualified path)

target.mrk: Single file selection (returns the fully qualified path)
